text: Richard George "Rick" MacLeish (January 3, 1950 - May 30, 2016) was a Canadian professional ice hockey forward. He played 14 seasons in the National Hockey League (NHL) with the Philadelphia Flyers, Hartford Whalers, Pittsburgh Penguins, and Detroit Red Wings. He played 12 seasons in Philadelphia, winning two Stanley Cups with the Flyers in 1974 and 1975. On May 11, 2016, MacLeish was hospitalized for meningitis. He died at a hospital in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania from kidney and liver failure as a result of meningitis on May 30, 2016, aged 66.Carchidi, Sam Rick MacLeish, smooth-skating, Cup-winning Flyer, dies at 66 The Philadelphia Inquirer, May 31, 2016 ==References== Category:1950 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Canadian ice hockey centres Category:Deaths from renal failure Category:Deaths from liver failure Category:Deaths from meningitis Category:Disease-related deaths in Pennsylvania Category:Philadelphia Flyers players Category:Hartford Whalers players Category:Pittsburgh Penguins players Category:Detroit Red Wings players Category:Sportspeople from Ontario Category:American Hockey League players Category:Ontario Hockey League players Category:Central Professional Hockey League players
title: Rick MacLeish
